about_the_game:
All children of Man seek the relic known as the Immaterium.
The Episcopate of Man says it can allow contact with the souls of humanity so that machinekin can gain inner peace through sublime knowledge. The heretic Old Believers claim it to be a prison which they have a duty to destroy in order to free the creators. The wretched followers of Isidore even believe opening the relic will lead to the destruction of all life in the universe.
Whatever the truth all the children of man, both the faithful and the heretic, all feel the call of the Immaterium.

Choose a faction and explore the vast reaches of space once inhabited by humanity in search of the key to the Immaterium. Turn-based combat veterans will recognize many gameplay elements inspired by the venerable Heroes of Might and Magic series.



  • Capture ancient mining stations and reclaim wreckage to maintain your existing fleet. No new vessels have been created for thousands of years!
  • The knowledge of creating new ships is nearly impossible! Boarding and capturing vessels is essential.
  • Convince AI spirits to join you and manage one of your fleets, each with unique abilities and growth paths.

short_description: Preserve the hierarchy of humanity's distant mechanical children by cleansing the galaxy in this transhumanist turn-based tactical tale. Capture resources from unworthy machines and summon powerful AI spirits to grow your faction's fleets of vessels blessed by Man the All-Maker.
